metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9894 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow in SkiaGl caused when a GrGLBuffer is truncated during allocation. Later writers will overflow the buffer, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 50.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9894` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
